result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James V Thomas Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James V Thomas Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for James V Thomas Jr.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and recently received an offer from the State. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant James V Thomas Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for James V Thomas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #12CF1323. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Kramschuster.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant James V Thomas not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Jail had no booths available to produce defendant. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James V Thomas in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant James V Thomas in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Reed advised the Court that Attorney Annamarie Wineke will be appointed to represent Mr. Thomas. Defendant requested to address bail. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant James V Thomas not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James V Thomas not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James V Thomas not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for James V Thomas Jr
Current: 2436 N 24th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 2405 North 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Varinder S
Robert D W
Terrance L T
Clark Gas Station at 905 W. Center St.

Defendant James V Thomas in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant James V Thomas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James V Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, court ordered charge modifier of COUNT 3 dimmissed. State to file amended complaint or update Information be next court date. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
